node.display_long_description:
BIGGEST FPS ON QUEST with 24 Player Matches!

Tom's Guide: #1 Oculus Quest 2 game
Forbes: "One of the best VR games for the Oculus Quest 2"
#1 VR Multiplayer Game for 2020 Holiday

CLIMB, FLY, BUILD. Battle Royale only possible in VR.
 
Drop into a colorful, near future world with limitless combat possibilities. Welcome to POPULATION: ONE, where you and your squad must fight together to survive until the end. 
 
POPULATION: ONE delivers unparalleled vertical freedom and mobility with its unique Vertical combat System. Fly through the map to rain down bullets from above. Climb anything you see to gain the high ground advantage. Build strategic cover to protect your squad. Use your environment to FIGHT ANYWHERE. 
 
In POPULATION: ONE, the action never stops with ongoing live in-game events and fresh content to explore.

CROSS-BUY - Buy for Rift or Quest and get the other free

latest_supported_binary.change_log: The best version of POP: ONE to date!

nodes.title: Season 2 Change List!
nodes.body_text:
May 13, 2021 Season 2 Update

New Items
Matadors
- Dual wielded shotguns
- 8 shots in each gun
- Every shot fires 4 pellets that each deal 3 damage (for base level)
- Damage per pellet increases each rarity level
- Reload with a flicking hand gesture

Harmonica
- Music emitting device that restores teammate’s shield
- Does not regenerate shield for the person playing the harmonica
- Can regenerate up to 8 shield per second at full power
- When starting to play music, the regeneration begins at 2 shield per second
- Regeneration increases over 12 seconds until it reaches full power
- If shot while playing, the power level is reset

Shield Shaker
- Shield regenerating drink (additional to the Shield Soda)
- Shake to charge up the drink for 5 seconds and the top will pop up when complete
- Regenerates 50 shield immediately when drank
- Stacks 3 per slot in inventory

Gameplay Changes
General
- Player Count: Player count for all modes increased from 18 -> 24
- Player Count: Squads mode is now 8 squads of 3
- Battle Zone: Hold times between zone movement doubled
- Battle Zone: Zone move speed decreased from 3.5 -> 2.5 m/s
- Battle Zone: Zone size is now on average 25% smaller per zone
- Ghost: Move speed increased from 50% -> 75% when downed

Gun Balance
ARs:
- AKM damage increased 16 -> 17
- M60: Rounds per second lowered 9 -> 8
- M60: Body damage lowered 22 -> 20
- M60: Full Damage Range lowered from 125m -> 100m (after this distance, damage starts decreasing)
- M60: Ramp up shots increased from 8 -> 10 (takes 10 shots before firing at full speed)
- M60: Much more wild when 1-handing

SMGs:
- P90: Damage increased 12 -> 13

Shotguns:
- DT11: Damage per pellet decreased 8 -> 7 (potential damage per shot lowered 72 -> 63)

Item Balance
- Katana: Vaulted (still available in Private Rooms)
- Health & Shield Sodas: Points to heal/regenerate lowered from 50 -> 20
- Health & Shield Sodas: Time to heal lowered to 10 seconds (2 per second).
- Health & Shield Sodas: Stack size increased from 3 -> 6.
- Small Battery: Regen amount increased from 5 -> 10
- Medium Battery: Regen amount increased from 10 -> 20
- Loot: Very minor tweaks to item spawn chances & rarity chances

Private Rooms Beta
Room Browser
- New Private Room Browser for viewing Open Private Rooms to join
- Rooms set to “Open” will show in the Room Browser list
- Allows players to easily discover other rooms

New Customization
Voice Options:
- Options for team, proximity, team proximity, or open voice channels.

Match Settings:
- Weapons/Items: Choose which items are/aren’t available during a match

Team Settings:
- Squad size (Solos, Duos, Squads, etc...)
- Friendly fire (on / off)

Zone Settings:
- Zone damage rate multiplier
- Zone delay multiplier
- Zone move speed multiplier
- Option to spawn launch towers on opposite sides of the zone

Advanced:
- Option for Shield Regeneration which increases shield automatically over time
- Damage multiplier
- Revive (on / off)
- Health/Armor amount players spawn with after revive
- Revive respawn item
- Ghost move speed

New Room Settings
- Ability to transfer private room leader
- Option to hide room code
- Set the room name which is displayed in the Room Browser

Environment Changes
New Region - The Frontier
- “The Frontier" has overtaken Cliffside — the Wild West has arrived to Pop1
- The Frontier marks a new town with a Saloon, Bureau Train Station, an open desert range, and much more!
- New exploding and lootable barrels have been added to this new region

Season 2 Limited Content
Battle Pass
- 50 tiers total of new unlockable rewards (13 free rewards)
- Get access to all Battle Pass tiers for 330 Bureau Gold
- Re-designed point award system: daily dailies, stacked weeklies, & legendary challenges

General
Audio
- New intro music and loading music
- New themed environment audio for the Frontier

Particles
- All particle effects for the drop pods improved
- Red loot pod smoke improved
- Improved door and window break effects
- New build tile create/destroy effects
- Player hit effects (blood/shield) improved

Matchmaker
- Countdown will shorten the wait time as more players fill a server
- Prevents waiting on 23 players for an extended period of time
- Biases towards starting the match instead of waiting several minutes for a final player

Social Content
- Clicking on a friend in the Social Panel will display their calling card

Thursday Double Day
- Season 2 will have double XP every Thursday, all season
- Starts at 11:59 pm Pacific and runs until 4 am Pacific the next day

Known Issues
- Steam VR: Matador flick reload is more difficult than it should be

nodes.title: Weekly POP:ONE Update!
nodes.body_text:
April 15, 2021 Change List

Private Rooms New Features
- Once a team is manually set, teams no longer get shuffled when a new user joins or leaves (Changing Game Modes re-enables team number balancing)
- Players can now join a room with a squad
- A new room Leader will be automatically assigned if the current leader leaves
- Added popup to inform the new leader they are the leader
- Added a 1 hour countdown timer to force room closure and refresh the server - Prevents weird falling through world issues
- Added popup toast for 10, 5, and 1 minute server closure countdowns
- Disabled "Start Match" if you're the only one in the room

Private Rooms Fixes
- Fixed issue where the round would end if a player joined as a spectator / in the middle of the match
- Fixed issue where the game continued after the player died in Solos
- Fixed issue where the end of Match screen could appear underground
- Player now receives a notification if they were kicked from the server

General Fixes
- PC & Quest 2: Fixed issue where the level of detail could lower to Quest 1 level of detail
- Calling Cards: Removed stats
- Store: Fixed issue where bundles did not calculate correct funds

Support
For support visit http://support.bigboxvr.com to get access to self-help resources or file a ticket

Known Issues
- PC VR: Cannot snap turn or smooth turn while in pods
- Steam VR users playing on an Oculus headset: When Purchasing Bureau Gold, you will need to take off your headset to approve the purchase
- If you see a notice that you need to "update to play" but don't see it in the store, uninstall and reinstall POP: ONE to force the upgrade to happen. You won't lose any progress or data
​
~ see you in game!

node.reviewDescription:
This game was hands-down the best game for Quest, literally ignored all my other games once I got into it, completely fluid and immersive. However now the game is dominated by a top tier of elite players, with thousands of kills, who just move around the map kill farming other players and making it unplayable for the majority. If Big Box consider skill matching lobbies in the future, I will definitely pick it up again, but until then, with a heavy heart, I would say avoid.

Update: They have introduced tiered lobbies now! I miss smashing noobs, be careful what you wish for. Now 5 stars.
